scenario: Elite special forces team DELTA-7 must infiltrate cartel-controlled underground tunnel networks near Juarez to rescue multiple groups of hostages held in fortified prison cells. Intelligence indicates a narrow window before the hostages are moved deeper into Mexico. The labyrinthine tunnels are rigged with alarms, the cartel has superior numbers, and any mistake could trigger an international incident. Success requires precise coordination, resource management, and split-second tactical decisions.

initial_world_state.location: Warehouse staging area 2km from border - pre-dawn darkness provides cover
initial_world_state.time_pressure: Intel suggests hostages will be moved at sunrise (4 hours)

branching_points.decision: Split team to hit multiple locations or maintain unit integrity
Engage guards or risk deeper stealth penetration
Extract partial hostages or push for complete rescue

primary_objectives: Resource allocation under extreme time pressure
embedded_decision_points: Entry point selection based on incomplete intelligence
